networkStats.title: Network Stats
networkStats.subtitleTestnet: Stats are occasionally reset on testnet.

table.statusTooltip: The finality status of the block
table.batchTooltip: The batch index where the block transactions are submitted to L1
table.timestampTooltip: The date and time at which a block is mined
table.blockNumberTooltip: Block height, indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of the new block
table.blockSizeTooltip: Number of transactions inside the block
table.blockHashTooltip: The hash of the current block
table.commitTxHashTooltip: Hash of the L1 transaction sent to the smart contract to commit the block
table.committedAtTooltip: Time when the block was committed
table.proveTxHashTooltip: Hash of the L1 transaction in which block was proven
table.executeTxHashTooltip: Hash of the L1 transaction in which block was executed
table.notFoundHomePage: We haven't had any blocks yet. Please, check again later.
table.prividiumNotFoundHomePage: No blocks are visible to you at this time

transactionTable.title: Block Transactions
transactionTable.noTransactions: This Block doesn't have any transactions
transactionTable.prividiumNoTransactions: No transactions are visible to you in this block
transactionTable.blockNotFound: This Block has not been created or sealed yet

blocks.tooltipInfo: Latest blocks produced by the network

transfers.notFound: Address doesn't have any transfers at this moment
transfers.prividiumNotFound: No transfers are visible to you for this address

table.reasonTooltip: The revert reason of the transaction
table.errorTooltip: The error message of the transaction
table.transactionHashTooltip: Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated whenever a transaction is executed
table.nonceTooltip: Number of transactions sent from a sender address
table.timestampTooltip: The date and time at which a transaction is produced
table.fromTooltip: The sending party of the transaction
table.toTooltip: The receiving party of the transaction
table.tokensTransferredTooltip: List of tokens transferred within this transaction
table.blockTooltip: Number of the block in which the transaction is recorded
table.batchTooltip: The batch index where this transaction is submitted to L1
table.valueTooltip: Amount of Ether being transferred from one address to another within a transaction.
table.feeTooltip: Fee which sender paid for this transaction, amount in chosen asset & price in USD at the current time
table.contractAddressTooltip: The receiving party of the transaction (could be a contract address)
table.inputDataTooltip: Additional data included for this transaction. Commonly used as part of contract interaction or as a message sent to the recipient.
table.notYetSentOnTheChain: Not yet sent on the chain
table.notFoundHomePage: We haven't had any transactions yet. Please, check again later.
table.prividiumNotFoundHomePage: No transactions are visible to you at this time
table.gasLimitAndUsedTooltip: Maximum amount of gas allocated for the transaction & the amount eventually used.
table.gasPerPubdataTooltip: Maximum amount of gas the user is willing to pay for a single byte of published data (pubdata).

errors.signature_decode_limited: Contract not verified - showing method signature only (parameter values unavailable)

batches.title: Batches
batches.indexTooltip: The L1 Batch number indicates the length of L1 Batches produced by grouping L2 blocks to be proven on Ethereum
batches.sizeTooltip: Number of transactions inside of the L1 Batch
batches.timestampTooltip: The date and time at which L1 Batch is produced
batches.rootHashTooltip: The L1 Batch Root is a cryptographic hash (or Merkle root) that summarizes a batch of L2 transactions or data and is submitted to the L1 blockchain as a single transaction
batches.commitTxHashTooltip: Hash of L1 transaction on which this L1 Batch was committed
batches.committedAtTooltip: The date and time at which L1 Batch is committed to Ethereum
batches.proveTxHashTooltip: Hash of L1 transaction on which this L1 Batch was proven
batches.provenAtTooltip: The date and time at which L1 Batch is proven to Ethereum
batches.executeTxHashTooltip: Hash of L1 transaction on which this L1 Batch was executed
batches.executedAtTooltip: The date and time at which L1 Batch is executed on Ethereum
batches.notYetSealed: This batch is not sealed yet

transactionTable.title: Batch Transactions
transactionTable.noTransactions: This Batch doesn't have any transactions
transactionTable.prividiumNoTransactions: No transactions are visible to you in this batch
transactionTable.batchNotFound: This Batch has not been created or sealed yet

table.notFoundHomePage: We haven't had any batches yet. Please, check again later.
table.prividiumNotFoundHomePage: No batches are visible to you at this time

batches.tooltipInfo: Latest batches submitted to Ethereum Network

searchForm.placeholder: Search by address, block number, contract, or tx hash

estimatedCost.title: Estimated cost of transfers & interactions

blockExplorer.title: {brandName} Block Explorer
blockExplorer.subtitle: {brandName} Block Explorer provides all the information to deep dive into transactions, blocks, contracts, and much more. Deep dive into {brandName} and explore the network.
blockExplorer.prividiumSubtitle: {brandName} private and access-controlled blockchain explorer provides all the information to deep dive into transactions, blocks, contracts, and much more.

failedRequest: Failed to show .... Please, try to refresh the page.

contract.title: Contract
contract.verifiedTooltip: The contract's source code has been verified to match its on-chain Bytecode. Source code verification does not imply the contract is safe to interact with.

notFound.subtitle: We can’t find any transaction related to this smart-contract. It's your chance to be the first

events.notFound: Smart Contract doesn't have any events at this moment

abiInteraction.metaMaskNotFound: MetaMask not found. Please install MetaMask to continue.
abiInteraction.verifyImplementationMessage: Please verify the implementation contract in order to Read/Write the contract as Proxy.
abiInteraction.proxyCautionMessage: Please note that the proxy identification process is based on analysis of popular proxy standards and might not be always accurate. Proceed with caution when interacting with any smart contract.

contractVerification.title: Smart Contract Verification
contractVerification.subtitle: Source code verification provides transparency for users interacting with smart contracts. By uploading the source code, Explorer will match the compiled code with that on the blockchain.

resources.title: You can also verify your smart-contract using {hardhat}

contractAddress.title: Contract Address
contractAddress.underline: The 0x address supplied on contract creation.

validation.not_valid: Please, provide a valid contract address

contractName.label: Contract Name
contractName.solcUnderline: Must match the name specified in the code. For example, in contract MyContract { '{..}' } MyContract is the contract name.
contractName.vyperUnderline: Must match the filename. For example, in contract MyContract.vy MyContract is the contract name.

contractPath.label: Contract Path
contractPath.underline: Relative path to your contract at the moment of compilation

runs.label: Runs
runs.underline: Optimize for how many times you intend to run the code. Lower values will optimize more for initial deployment cost, higher values will optimize more for high-frequency usage.

optimizationUsed.label: Optimization
optimizationUsed.underline: If you enabled optimization during compilation, select yes.

flattenerInfo.title: If your contract uses "imports", you will need to concatenate the code into one file ( otherwise known as "flattening" ). For that purpose you can use {flattener} or {flattery}

verified.title: Contract verified!
verified.underline: Anyone on {link} could check it’s code and interact with it

compilationInfo.autoVerified: The contract wasn't manually verified, but its bytecode matches the bytecode of the following contract:
compilationInfo.partialVerification: Contract is partially verified: the contract metadata hash and/or constructor arguments do not match. Partial verification provides less guarantees about the authenticity of the code.
